question: Who got the most runs in the Women's Cricket World Cup tournaments?
explanation: Debbie Hockley got the most runs in the Women's Cricket World Cup tournaments. Deborah Ann Hockley is a former New Zealand cricketer. Hockley captained New Zealand in six Tests, drawing them all. She was also Player of the match in the World Cup final played in India in 1997 and holds the record for scoring the most runs by any woman in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup (1501), playing in five World Cups. Hockley was the first woman to reach 4000 ODI runs and to play 100 ODIs. She was also the first woman to score 1,000 runs in ODIs for New Zealand.
